page.title: 05Rainford Principle Features
page.content: Rainford only has two principle features,the white statues and the stocks. The white statues are situated at the south end of Church Road,and they have an interesting story behind them. They used to be gateposts for a school called Image House Academy,a school for boys,which 17 pupils attended.They depict the gods Mars and Minerva.The reason they are quite far apart is because carriages would have ridden in and out. In 1952,the year of Queen Elizabeth II's coronation,the statues were painted in the colours of the Union Jack.Rainford's stocks may not have been genuine.They may have never been used at all.The stones at either side are probably genuine,but the wood was replaced by Winstanleys the builders in around 1950.
